header_summary:
Nighttime Satoshi's revised proposal for the Bitcoin network introduces methods for reclaiming dust UTXOs and addressing coinbase transaction limitations, emphasizing solutions at the Layer 1 level to enhance network efficiency without altering foundational rules. This proposal includes creating a "Dust Fee Authorization" transaction to allow miners to claim dust UTXOs under specific conditions, potentially increasing Bitcoin's fungibility by integrating these small-value satoshis back into circulation. [Read more about the proposal](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CALQsJZX=6zNc-_b8MjHu-KftjqiJtScLVULCtHeLDNBo_2OQqQ@mail.gmail.com/T/#mf7a50506b3979cdbbe6743312716700585772ac0).

Sergio Demian Lerner's advancement in the BitVM and BitVMX protocols introduces the ESSPI method, employing ECDSA/Schnorr signatures to significantly reduce storage overhead, marking a pivotal shift in the protocols' efficiency and application scope. This innovation, alongside a suite of other improvements, promises to expand BitVMX's functionalities and address previous limitations related to one-time signature schemes, potentially revolutionizing program input signing with its 1:1 data expansion ratio. [Discover the full paper details](https://bitvmx.org/files/esspi-ecdsa-input-bitvmx.pdf).

The discussion around Bitcoin covenants has seen a growing positive sentiment among developers, highlighted by proposals such as the Great Script Restoration project and OP_TXHASH opcode, aiming to expand Bitcoin's utility while maintaining its core principles. These developments, alongside the cautious optimism for enhancing Bitcoin's expressiveness through technologies like CTV and CSFS opcodes, indicate a collaborative effort within the community to refine covenant technology for integration into the Bitcoin protocol. [Learn about covenant proposals and feedback](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/ctv-csfs-can-we-reach-consensus-on-a-first-step-towards-covenants/1509).

An alternative approach to mitigating Miner Extractable Value (MEV) involves deploying a network of specialized software agents to identify and neutralize MEV opportunities, preserving Bitcoin's decentralization. This agent-based model, focusing on protocol layer solutions rather than marketplace intermediaries, suggests a shift towards more adaptive and decentralized methods of MEV mitigation, which could be implemented without consensus changes in the blockchain protocol. [Explore the agent-based MEV mitigation proposal](https://delvingbitcoin.org/t/best-worst-case-mevil-response/1465/7).

recent_posts.title: Proposal: Unlocking Dust UTXOs as Miner Transaction Fees
recent_posts.summary:
- The revised proposal addresses coinbase limitations and dust UTXO issues in Bitcoin's network.
- It suggests allowing miners to batch and claim dust UTXOs, maintaining economic viability.
- The proposal seeks community feedback to improve Bitcoin's fungibility and economic rationality.

recent_posts.title: ESSPI: ECDSA/Schnorr Signed Program Input for BitVMX
recent_posts.summary:
- The ESSPI method introduces ECDSA/Schnorr for BitVMX input, achieving a 1:1 data expansion.
- Four innovations, including a new CPU and fraud detection, enhance BitVMX protocol efficiency.
- These advancements expand BitVMX applications and address previous signature scheme inefficiencies.

recent_posts.title: CTV+CSFS: Can we reach consensus on a first step towards covenants?
recent_posts.summary:
- Positive sentiment towards Bitcoin covenants is growing among developers on social platforms.
- The [Great Script Restoration](https://rusty.ozlabs.org/2024/01/19/the-great-opcode-restoration.html) project aims to enhance Bitcoin's script capabilities.
- The community is cautiously optimistic about developing covenant technologies like [OP_TXHASH opcode](https://covenants.info/proposals/txhash/).

recent_posts.title: Best-(Worst-)Case MEVil Response
recent_posts.summary:
- An alternative to marketplace proposals for MEV mitigation focuses on an agent-based system for Bitcoin.
- This system deploys software agents to detect, respond to, and coordinate against MEV by adjusting transactions.
- It aims to preserve decentralization and adapt to new MEV techniques without central trust.

recent_posts.title: Revisiting pathfinding
recent_posts.summary:
- Pathfinding in the lightning network heavily depends on gossip data, posing reliability issues.
- A solution suggests nodes request path info from peers, enhancing reliability and fee control.
- Privacy concerns arise, yet trends show a growing preference for reliability, with privacy as optional.

active_posts.title: Proposal for Quantum-Resistant Address Migration Protocol (QRAMP) BIP
active_posts.summary:
- The QRAMP aims to make Bitcoin quantum-resistant by migrating funds to new addresses.
- It sets a strict timeline to prevent risks associated with slow voluntary transitions.
- The proposal includes backward compatibility, security measures, and a call for community feedback.

active_posts.title: Update on the Great Consensus Cleanup Revival
active_posts.summary:
- The Bitcoin community is addressing vulnerabilities highlighted by Matt Corallo's 2019 proposal.
- Recent updates focus on preventing attacks and improving transaction and block validation security.
- A draft BIP is in progress, aiming to significantly enhance Bitcoin's consensus mechanism.

active_posts.title: "Recursive covenant" with CTV and CSFS
active_posts.summary:
- Twitter debates focus on activating CheckTemplateVerify and CheckSigFromStack in Bitcoin.
- Critics question the ability of these proposals to avoid creating recursive covenants.
- Discussions also explore practical applications and alternative technical solutions.

active_posts.title: How to linearize your cluster
active_posts.summary:
- Optimizing transaction clusters in cryptocurrency is crucial for processing efficiency.
- Advanced techniques involve sorting by fee rates and optimizing through bottleneck splitting and iterative searches.
- The current implementation streamlines selection with LIFO stacks and caching, improving upon simpler methods.

active_posts.title: Libbitcoin for Core people
active_posts.summary:
- Eric Voskuil highlights Libbitcoin's IBD is up to 15 times faster than Bitcoin Core's.
- Libbitcoin uses an event-based, asynchronous system and a relational database structure for better performance.
- Despite advancements, Libbitcoin lacks full DoS protection and uses outdated libsecp, affecting performance metrics.

active_posts.title: Antoine Poinsot on Bitcoin Core's Priorities
active_posts.summary:
- AntoineP discusses fragmented efforts in Bitcoin Core's development, highlighting a lack of unified direction.
- The second post emphasizes the need for a stable foundation for the Bitcoin network through balanced development.
- The third blog proposes dividing Bitcoin Core into three binaries to streamline development and focus efforts.

today_in_history_posts.title: BIP75 - Out of Band Address Exchange
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- BIP 75's title is now "Out of Band Address Exchange using Payment Protocol Encryption."- It adds optional fields to paymentDetails, like subtractable fee and fee per kb.
- The update invites feedback and addresses automation of transaction settings.

today_in_history_posts.title: Backward deterministic R Value
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- The proposal introduces a new deterministic RValue generation method to streamline off-chain signature storage.
- It ensures security through a backward deterministic RValue, allowing for easier verification of commitment revocation.
- Alice faces increased computational effort, as each new commitment requires regenerating or pre-computing hashes.

today_in_history_posts.title: Deflationary money is a Good Thing
today_in_history_posts.summary:
- Investment strategies are divided into passive and active types, each with distinct engagement levels.
- Passive investing can cause societal issues, including asset underutilization and principal/agent misalignments.
- The blog suggests central banks might stabilize economies using fiat currencies backed by deflationary ones like Bitcoin.
